user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 14.3 is: Controlling expressions shall not be invariant.
Here are exceptions to this rule:
1. Invariants that are used to create infinite loops are permitted.
2. A do-while loop with an essentially Boolean controlling expression that evaluates to false and satisfies the constraints and semantics for an integer constant expression is permitted.
</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of OS_QueuePut:
```c
int32 OS_QueuePut(osal_id_t queue_id, const void *data, size_t size, uint32 flags)
{
    OS_object_token_t           token;
    int32                       return_code;
    OS_queue_internal_record_t *queue;

    /* Check Parameters */
    OS_CHECK_POINTER(data);
    OS_CHECK_SIZE(size);

    return_code = OS_ObjectIdGetById(OS_LOCK_MODE_NONE, LOCAL_OBJID_TYPE, queue_id, &token);
    if (return_code == OS_SUCCESS)
    {
        queue = OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET(OS_queue_table, token);

        if (size > queue->max_size)
        {
            /*
            ** The buffer that the user is passing in is too large
            */
            return_code = OS_QUEUE_INVALID_SIZE;
        }
        else
        {
            return_code = OS_QueuePut_Impl(&token, data, size, flags);
        }
    }

    return return_code;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function OS_QueuePut:
#define OS_CHECK_POINTER(ptr) BUGCHECK((ptr)!=NULL,OS_INVALID_POINTER)
...
#define OS_CHECK_SIZE(val) ARGCHECK((val)>0&&(val)<(UINT32_MAX/2),OS_ERR_INVALID_SIZE)
...
int32 OS_ObjectIdGetById(OS_lock_mode_t lock_mode, osal_objtype_t idtype, osal_id_t id, OS_object_token_t *token)
{
    int32 return_code;

    return_code = OS_ObjectIdTransactionInit(lock_mode, idtype, token);
    if (return_code != OS_SUCCESS)
    {
        return return_code;
    }

    return_code = OS_ObjectIdToArrayIndex(idtype, id, &token->obj_idx);
    if (return_code == OS_SUCCESS)
    {
        token->obj_id = id;

        /*
         * The "ConvertToken" routine will return with the global lock
         * in a state appropriate for returning to the caller, as indicated
         * by the "check_mode" parameter.
         *
         * Note If this operation fails, then it always unlocks the global for
         * all check_mode's other than NONE.
         */
        return_code = OS_ObjectIdConvertToken(token);
    }

    if (return_code != OS_SUCCESS)
    {
        OS_ObjectIdTransactionCancel(token);
    }

    return return_code;
}
...
#define OS_SUCCESS (0)
...
#define OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET(tbl, tok) (&tbl[OS_ObjectIndexFromToken(&(tok))])
...
OS_queue_internal_record_t OS_queue_table[LOCAL_NUM_OBJECTS]
...
typedef struct
{
    char              queue_name[OS_MAX_API_NAME];
    size_t            max_size;
    osal_blockcount_t max_depth;
} OS_queue_internal_record_t
...
typedef struct OS_object_token OS_object_token_t
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: I have not flagged the if statements and other explicit controlling expressions in OS_QueuePut and OS_ObjectIdGetById because they depend on variables or parameters that are assigned or passed in earlier (e.g. "if (return_code == OS_SUCCESS)" where return_code is set just above, and "if (size > queue->max_size)" which uses the runtime value of size and queue->max_size). Those are not invariant. The macro OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET expands to an array index based on OS_ObjectIndexFromToken(&tok) which depends on token, so its controlling expression is not invariant. The only places that can hide invariant controlling expressions are the macros BUGCHECK/ARGCHECK (invoked via OS_CHECK_POINTER and OS_CHECK_SIZE) because macros often contain do/while or other control constructs; their definitions were not provided here. Per MISRA Rule 14.3 these macro expansions should be inspected to ensure any invariant controlling expressions are either the allowed do-while(false) pattern or legitimate infinite loops as permitted by the rule's exceptions.
